alert.note: Alert for Kootenai (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 7:05AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Rain and melting snow today will contribute to rises on creeks and streams in north Idaho. Rock slides and mudslides in steep terrain may also be possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...Until Noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Field flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage. There is also a heightened potential for rock and mudslides in steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The Idaho Panhandle will receive another round of rain today with localized amounts of a quarter to half inch this morning. Melting snow will also contribute to runoff the next couple of days. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
